title: The Block 2019: Behind the scenes as relationships sour
text:
Battlelines were drawn the moment contestants on The Block denied Mitch and Mark’s rooftop spa.

The stylish grandads decided to draw the line and retreat into their Block bubble and focus on their own renovation and no one else.

Their Hipages builder Jason Charles, of Charles Bro Building Contractors, said all the contestants would help unload materials on the site together but the boys would then retreat.

RELATED: Behind the scenes on heated clash over spa

When Mitch and Mark knew they had nailed it

What it’s like to be a tradie on The Block

Mr Charles said the boys were great mates with neighbours Tess and Luke but that friendship had soured after the spa debacle.

“There was also an interview on radio with Tess and Luke saying they didn’t need grandads in their life, it wasn’t great,” he said.

And, it is not just Tess and Luke that the boys are staying away from.

Mr Charles said in week three he got one of his waterproofers to come in on a day off to help Jesse and Mel in house five in return for four hours of painting.

“Jesse did a little bit of corking but still owed me two hours of painting, but we let it go in the end as the boys didn’t want him in their house,” he said.

As to Jesse’s claim that he allowed Charles Bro Building Contractors to work for Mitch and Mark after interviewing them to be his own builder, Mr Charles said that wasn’t the case.

“Mitch and Mark and Jesse and Mel both contacted me to come on board as their builder, I turned up to site to meet both, Jesse and Mel were busy so we met the boys and loved them,” he said.

“It was so much fun with them and we enjoyed ourselves.”

While there may be tensions between contestants, that is not the case with the tradies.

Mr Charles said they got on really well with other tradies working on the site.

“A lot were from the northern suburbs; it was a good opportunity to meet them,” he said.

description: Are all couples on The Block still friends off air or do the rivalries and disagreements continue when the cameras stop rolling? Good relationships have soured. Go behind the scenes.
